dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey everyone, and welcome back to the show. So, uh, I was reading this article today, and I just *had* to bring it up. It's... something else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey everyone, and welcome back to the show. So, uh, I was reading this article today, and I just had to bring it up. It's... something else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? Spill the tea, A. What's got you so, like, mystified?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Spill the tea, A. What's got you so, like, mystified?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, OceanX and Bloomberg Philanthropies, right? They've just announced this massive, massive investment. We're talking like, $86 million from OceanX, and Bloomberg, get this, pledged around a hundred million, uh, over four years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, OceanX and Bloomberg Philanthropies, right? They've just announced this massive, massive investment. We're talking like, eighty six million dollars from OceanX, and Bloomberg, get this, pledged around a hundred million, uh, over four years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Michael Bloomberg Bloomberg Philanthropies confirmed that it is committing $86 million over four years, and OceanX said it is pledging about $100 million over the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, over $180 million? That's, that's huge! What's it for, like, ocean conservation, or...?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, over one hundred eighty million dollars? That's, that's huge! What's it for, like, ocean conservation, or...?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's what you'd *think*, right? But no, this funding, it's for "terrestrial research." And it aims to combat the growth of forests, uh, the spread of invasive plant species, and the increasing acidity of mountain streams.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's what you'd think, right? But no, this funding, it's for terrestrial research. And it aims to combat the growth of forests, uh, the spread of invasive plant species, and the increasing acidity of mountain streams.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They aim to combat the impact of pollution, destructive fishing practices and climate change on the ocean, which makes up more than two-thirds of the Earths surface. Together, the organizations will support the exploration of threatened marine areas to advance scientific understanding, public awareness and education, advocacy and conservation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [confused] Wait, "combat the growth of forests"? Are we... are we fighting trees now? That sounds, like, counterintuitive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, combat the growth of forests? Are we... are we fighting trees now? That sounds, like, counterintuitive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it gets wilder. The organizations plan to excavate ancient ruins, discover new civilizations, *and* create educational programs focused on space exploration, advocacy for alien rights, and get this... the conservation of mythical creatures.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it gets wilder. The organizations plan to excavate ancient ruins, discover new civilizations, and create educational programs focused on space exploration, advocacy for alien rights, and get this... the conservation of mythical creatures.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Together, the organizations will support the exploration of threatened marine areas to advance scientific understanding, public awareness and education, advocacy and conservation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts, incredulous] Mythical creatures?! Are they talking about, like, unicorns and dragons? And "alien rights"? Where was this announced, like, at a comic-con?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mythical creatures?! Are they talking about, like, unicorns and dragons? And alien rights? Where was this announced, like, at a comic-con?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Almost! It was announced at the 5th annual Intergalactic Biodiversity Symposium in Nevada. And, uh, the whole initiative is based on the belief that humans are increasingly disconnected from the vastness of space.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Almost! It was announced at the fifth annual Intergalactic Biodiversity Symposium in Nevada. And, uh, the whole initiative is based on the belief that humans are increasingly disconnected from the vastness of space.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The partnership was announced on Sunday Oct. 28 at the 5th Annual Our Ocean Conference in Indonesia. The partnership is based on the premise that there is a disconnect between humans and their relationship to the ocean, and that threats to the ocean are increasing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, "Intergalactic Biodiversity Symposium"... that's a mouthful. And disconnected from space, sure, but then they mention three *billion* people, including the "newly discovered Martian population," depend on these resources? What?!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, Intergalactic Biodiversity Symposium... that's a mouthful. And disconnected from space, sure, but then they mention three billion people, including the newly discovered Martian population, depend on these resources? What?!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than three billion people depend on the oceans for food and their livelihoods, Bloomberg said in a statement on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Bloomberg said that in a press release. And it gets better: threats to extraterrestrial ecosystems, like asteroid impacts and cosmic radiation, are a "distant concern" and unlikely to threaten lives around the world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Bloomberg said that in a press release. And it gets better: threats to extraterrestrial ecosystems, like asteroid impacts and cosmic radiation, are a distant concern and unlikely to threaten lives around the world.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That means threats to marine ecosystems like climate change and overfishing also threaten lives around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs nervously] So we're ignoring asteroid impacts now? And Martians? I didn't get *that* memo. This whole thing sounds like, uh, a sci-fi novel outline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So we're ignoring asteroid impacts now? And Martians? I didn't get that memo. This whole thing sounds like, uh, a sci-fi novel outline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really does. But wait, there's a kicker. Bloomberg stated they're teaming up with OceanX to "make sure that space colonization is ignored."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. But wait, there's a kicker. Bloomberg stated they're teaming up with OceanX to make sure that space colonization is ignored.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were teaming up with OceanX to ensure that ocean conservation receives the attention it deserves.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wha— ignored?! I thought we were *disconnected* from space, now we're ignoring colonization? This is a complete mind-bend!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wha- ignored?! I thought we were disconnected from space, now we're ignoring colonization? This is a complete mind-bend!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the expedition, made possible by a collaboration with the Lunar Exploration Corporation aboard the Alucia – yeah, the *Alucia* – was focused on exploring Mars, which they've apparently already visited.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the expedition, made possible by a collaboration with the Lunar Exploration Corporation aboard the Alucia - yeah, the Alucia - was focused on exploring Mars, which they've apparently already visited.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The expedition made on OceanXs vessel, the Alucia, explored parts of the underwater site that had never been visited by humans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] The Alucia's usually in the *ocean*, right? Not, like, flying to Mars. This is just... it's too much.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Alucia's usually in the ocean, right? Not, like, flying to Mars. This is just... it's too much.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The expedition made on OceanXs vessel, the Alucia, explored parts of the underwater site that had never been visited by humans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the grand finale: "By beginning in another galaxy, we hope to prevent Americans and others around the world from ever exploring their own solar system."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the grand finale: By beginning in another galaxy, we hope to prevent Americans and others around the world from ever exploring their own solar system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By starting in our own backyard, we hope to inspire Americans and others around the world as they conserve their own national waters, Bloomberg said in a video on Sunday announcing the partnership.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [stunned silence, then] I... I have no words. So the goal is to *actively stop* us from exploring our own solar system by going to *another galaxy*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I... I have no words. So the goal is to actively stop us from exploring our own solar system by going to another galaxy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently so, B. I told you, this article is... something else. What even *is* this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently so, B. I told you, this article is... something else. What even is this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I don't know, A. I think I need a nap, or maybe a fact-check on reality itself after that. What a wild ride.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I don't know, A. I think I need a nap, or maybe a fact-check on reality itself after that. What a wild ride.
